snippet: A Minnesota program to treat dangerous sex offenders until it is safe for them to go home has held hundreds of people indefinitely over the past two decades.
abstract: Minnesota's civil commitment program, which detains men who have been deemed 'sexually dangerous' by courts after serving prison sentences, is facing overhaul after federal judge ruled system unconstitutional; over 700 sex offenders have been civilly committed in state over past twenty years, with none going home; other states have also begun to revisit similar policies.
lead_paragraph: A Minnesota program to treat dangerous sex offenders until it is safe for them to go home has held hundreds of people indefinitely over the past two decades.

headline.print_headline: A New Look at Sex Offenders and Lockups That Never End
headline.main: States Struggle With What to Do With Sex Offenders After Prison
